frame.name: Measure_mass
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame is concerned with nouns that denote <fen>Unit</fen>s of measurement for masses. The Frame Elements are <fen>Unit</fen>, <fen>Count</fen>, and <fen>Stuff</fen>.<ex>Jelena bought <fex name="Count">three</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">kilos</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of apples</fex>.</ex><ex>Add <fex name="Count">a</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">pound</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of sugar</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Count
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s of the measured mass.<ex>Serena found <fex name="Count">two</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">pounds</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of sugar</fex> in the freezer.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>The standardized quantity in terms of which other quantities of the same kind are measured.<ex>Take <fex name="Count">two</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">grams</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">DNI</fex> every day before and after dinner.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Stuff
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Stuff</fen> whose weight is being measured.<ex>Sue bought <fex name="Count">three</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">kilos</fex></t> <fex name="Stuff">of cat food</fex> on sale.</ex> </def-root>
